conclusion: To determine which blocks the toy car (A) will collide with and where it will eventually stop, we need to follow the sequence of events as demonstrated in the images.
The car is moving towards the right side of the image and is approaching a cluster of blocks.
The car first collides with a yellow block.
The car continues moving and seems to be deflected slightly by the initial collision.
The car then encounters a green block and collides with it.
The car proceeds further and collides with a red block.
After the series of collisions, the car comes to a stop near the red block.
The car gains momentum and collides with the first block (yellow) in its path.
Each subsequent collision changes the car's direction and reduces its speed.
After hitting the red block, the car loses enough momentum to stop.
The toy car (A) will collide with the yellow, green, and red blocks in that order and will eventually stop near the red block.
